messages.subject: California
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, I have not posted in a while, but always enjoy the discussions. I (and my 8 yo daughter) wanted to ask some advice/info from those of you in
messages.messageBody:
Hi all,
I have not posted in a while, but always enjoy the discussions.
I (and my 8 yo daughter) wanted to ask some advice/info from those of you in California, specifically the area around Palm Springs/Riverside/LA/N.of San Diego. I am taking my son to UU camp there on the 10th. Then I'll be staying with a friend a few days. After that we have about 3-4 days left to do something. We are on a very low budget and will be bringing a tent.
I'm wondering if any of you know of a low-cost (or free) campground in that area, that would not be so likely to be all filled up? Any ideas for things we could do/a place to stay?
Thanks for any input!
Sybelle
(in Benson, AZ, mom to Ingo,11 and Bibi,8)

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: California
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: freeform@juno.com To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: California Date: Mon, Feb 4, 2002, 7:14 PM Sacramento-ish, but
messages.messageBody:
----------
From: freeform@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: California
Date: Mon, Feb 4, 2002, 7:14 PM


Sacramento-ish, but we have deep roots in the bay area, and it's pretty
close. I always forget which Pam is Northern California and which is
Southern California, though.

----------

Pam S. -- southern California. Your Disneyland connection.
Pam H. -- northern California. Your... well, I make good cookies. <g>

We're in Tracy, now, about an hour south of Sacramento. We're moving near
Redding later this year, a couple or so hours north of Sacramento.

Pam H., the other unschooler



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

On Mon, 4 Feb 2002 12:58:19 EST PSoroosh@... writes:
> Or...
>
> Dar, who will soon be saying, "Let's do lunch."
>
> Where are you moving, Dar?
>
> --pam

Sacramento-ish, but we have deep roots in the bay area, and it's pretty
close. I always forget which Pam is Northern California and which is
Southern California, though.

Of curse, we'll be driving home through southern California, but that'll
be with a station wagon full of stuff, 2 cats, and a rat...

Dar
